general_advisory: Considering the above prediction, weather conditions in the next five days are likely to be favorable for sowing. Farmers should take advantage of this window to complete their sowing operation. Prevailing weather conditions favor the incidence of sucking pests. Necessary plant protection chemicals may be applied by mixing with stickers. In view of the forecast, farmers can resume agronomic practices and application of fertilizers in standing crops. This is the ideal time to transplant the seedlings of chilli, brinjal & early cauliflower in raised beds with proper drainage. Preventative spray of Carbendazim+Mancozeb @ 2g/l & Streptocyclin @1.5g/15lit of water should be applied to protect vegetable seedlings in cloudy weather. Protect the vegetable seedlings in nursery from rain by covering with plastic or polythene sheet over the nursery bed. Farmers are advised to add organic manure to the soil during land preparation as it enhances fertility and water holding capacity of the soil.

advisory: Incorporate well decomposed FYM @ 8 q/acre during the final land preparation.
Seed Treatment: Seeds should be treated with Trichoderma powder formulation @ 10 g/kg of seeds or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg of seed for 10 -12 hrs to control seed and soil borne diseases.
Recommended dose of Fertilizer: Apply 26 kg DAP + 10 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 in upland condition and 35 kg DAP + 13 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 per acre in medium and low land condition as basal application.

Weed Management: Apply pre-emergence herbicide Pretilachlor 30.7% EC @ 800ml/acre or Oxyflourfen 23.5% EC @ 250 ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water at 2-3 days after sowing. If pre-emergence herbicide has not been applied then apply Bispyribac sodium 10% SC @ 120ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water at 8-10 days after emergence of weed as post-emergence herbicide.

Complete the preparation of nursery with raised bed without delay. To transplant one -acre area about 320 m2 area (8 cents) nursery beds are required. Prepare wet nursery raised beds of 10cm high, 1.2 -1.5 m wide and of convenient length. Well defined irrigation/drainage channel of 30 -45 cm width must be kept in between two beds. Use 14 -16 kg seeds /acre of HYV and 5 -6 kg/acre of hybrids for nursery sowing.

Seed Treatment: Seeds should be treated with Trichoderma powder formulation @ 10 g/kg of seeds or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg or Captan 50% WP or Thiram 75% WP @ 3g/kg of seed for 12-24 hrs before sowing in the nursery to control seed and soil borne diseases.
Apply FYM or Compost @ 2 tonnes/acre or Vermicompost @1 tonne/acre uniformly over the soil before ploughing.

In zinc and boron deficient soil application Zinc Suplate @10kg/ac and Borax @2kg/ac is recommended at the time of sowing.
